results.content: Su inglés es super lento y causa mucha desesperación, monotonía y aburrimiento.

response.content: Hi Juan. Half the course lectures are open... people can have a great perception of my english before buying my courses - including at my YT channel or website. I don't have a native english - I'm native in portuguese - but I don't think my english is that bad. I guess you're confounding the audio/video edition with my speaking flow. My initial videos were very much edited indeed, for optimizing time length, as I had a lot of content to show... also, I teach to 161 countries... I can't simply start talking as if I were talking to an english native. I have spanish students also saying I speak english too fast... and asking for spanish subtitles. I have to speak for everyone to understand. But thanks for your review. Before 30 days, it's possible to ask for a refund. You're the 2nd person, in 50k, to complain about my english :) Can't please everyone. But I'll try to edit less the audio in the future courses. Thanks !

results.content: Sorry but I don't understand anything about your course. The fact that you pause between each word makes the courtship incomprehensible. There is no intonation that indicates the end of a sentence, each word is separated by a blank, it is just totally unbearable. I held 1 hour, I will not last until the end. Sorry

response.content: Thanks Frederic Charliers for the honesty in expressing your individual perception. If you paid, you can ask for a refund, including if you didn't understand my "edited" speaking flow or pronunciation. But from 40 thousand students, from 159 countries and nationalities, you're the first one to say I'm incomprehensible. And I don't think that's that bad. The course would be too much longer if not edited. Video edition brings much efficiency, but even on big movies an edited video doesn't keep a normal speaking flow, not by far. I'm sorry if that didn't suit your listening expectations. Thanks for the feedback anyway.

results.content:
It's a good course to start with XML and XSD. It could be in sometimes slow but I think it is necessary in order to re-read the theory and understand better the explanations while proffesor is speaking.
If you search for a faster course and only watch videos, this is not your course.

response.content: Thanks a lot Ana Belén Peinado Zamora for your awesome and useful review. You actually got right the main point about how I organized this course and why I decided to set it a lot different from others at Udemy... the objective here is not being fast... it is to really teach something (not just mention it) and make people understand all aspects of the syntax. I myself have some difficult with other Udemy courses because of how fast people explain content, in 2 or 3-minute classes, like if everyone already had that expertise on that subject. This course I did for those who are starting from ZERO, and so I had to use a progressive level of difficulty along the course... for a more advanced and applied XML course I'd have to use another reference instead. We have students from 159 countries... everyone has a different pace of learning and understanding, and most are not so fluent in English. If I did a faster course, people would have some natural difficulty in understanding. Thus I chose a progressive strategy, similar to university lectures. Not to other Udemy courses. Some people like, some don't. I can't please everyone. But I guess I succeeded in making a complete course regarding the proposed reference (W3Schools). That's a very much sufficient intro for people specializing later through more advanced books or courses out there if they need. Thanks again, regards, Daniel Pinheiro, Brazil.

response.content: Hi Manon Munoz-Ferrada, I've seen you've completed 34% of the course so far. I also saw you didn't pay anything for the course (if you had, you could get a refund in a 30-day period). The objective of this 11h-course is not being small, it is to be minimally complete (compared to W3CSchools' content) and teach something useful the way people all over the world can understand, specially those who never heard about xml or xsd... if you consult the W3C RECs or any book about the subject, you'll realize this course is still very synthetic. The 11h workload is on the title itself, as well as on the pdf and video presentations since the beginning. You shouldn't have expected anything less than that. And it will actually increase a lot when I add the next update. Regards, Daniel Pinheiro, danielpm1982.com@domainsbyproxy.com, danielpm1982.com .
